subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] The Call of Cthulhu, Quikscript Edition, now in ePub
msgSnippet: This is a thing of beauty. Thank you. oliver
messageBody:
This is a thing of beauty. Thank you.

oliver


On 3 May 2013, at 22:31, Nathan Sharfi <bonusfrogs@...> wrote:
 

After playing around with Pandoc, I've managed to get it to generate ePub files that work on my iOS 6.1 devices, at the very least. While <https://github.com/adiabatic/qs-literature> is still the repository URL for all this, the internal URL structure has been changed somewhat.

As a web page:
http://adiabatic.github.io/qs-literature/call-of-cthulhu.html

As an ePub:
http://adiabatic.github.io/qs-literature/call-of-cthulhu.epub

Features:

- tables of contents in Orthodox
- #859900 from <http://ethanschoonover.com/solarized>
- Kingsley with reasonably-sized punctuation
